question: Which two countries share the location of "Moravaian-Silesian Beskids"?
explanation: The Czech Republic and Slovakia share the location of Moravian-Silesian Beskids. It forms part of the western Beskids of the outer western Carpathians. Lysa Hora is the highest point of this mountain range which is 1323 metres above sea level. It forms part of the Beskydy Protected Landscape Area and houses Ostravice River and Celadenka River.
